intro: Coffea dewevrei, commonly known as the Duvvuru coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the highlands of Ethiopia, specifically the Duvvuru region, where it grows at elevations above 1,800 meters. The plant produces small, red berries that contain two seeds, which are used to make coffee. It is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and unique genetic makeup, it is considered a rare and valuable species in the coffee world.
